thread.title: Region golf | Great Bridge sweeps titles in 4A
thread.title_full: Region golf | Great Bridge sweeps titles in 4A | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: John Streit
title: Region golf | Great Bridge sweeps titles in 4A
text:
VIRGINIA BEACH After weeks of foul weather and the once-looming threat from Hurricane Joaquin, sunshine was the only thing soaking the course at Naval Air Station Oceana's Aeropines Golf Course for the Group 4A East Region golf tournament on Wednesday.
Favorite Great Bridge took full advantage of great course and weather conditions to win a team championship for the second consecutive year. It won in 5A in 2014.
The Wildcats, who finished with a team score of 311, seven strokes better than runner-up Monacan, qualified three golfers for the 4A state tournament.
"This is two in a row for us, so that's a good accomplishment," said Great Bridge's E.J. Whiten, who shot an even-par 72 to win the individual championship.
"I'm looking forward to competing in states with my teammates."
Whiten beat out Monacan's Addie Parker and Billy Troiano, who both shot 76 to tie for second.
Great Bridge's Carter Old shot a 77 to tie for fourth with Jamestown's Triston Buckley.
The Wildcats' Conference 17 regular-season champion, Kendall Turner, shot a 78 to share sixth place alongside Jamestown's William Bell.
Five golfers shot 79 to tie for eighth and qualify for the state tournament.
Whitten birdied the par-5 seventh and par-4 10th to go 2 under par.
A double bogey on the par-3 16th and a bogey on the par-5 17th dropped him to 1 over.
Whiten responded with a birdie on the par-4 18th.
"The greens are small here - this is a tough course," Whiten said. "I'm glad I was able to rebound. Overall, it was a good round."
